images.copyright: Bathing huts on the beach in Skåne County, Sweden (© Martin Wahlborg/Getty Images)
images.title: Chromatic coastline
images.caption: Colourful bathing huts on the beach in Skåne County, Sweden
images.desc: When it comes to vibrant beach scenes, Skåne County in Sweden, doesn't disappoint. Today's image features pastel huts in Skanörs Havsbad, a sandy beach section in the town of Skanör. This is one of the most popular parts of the beach, which stretches for over 10 kilometres, on the western side of the Falsterbonäset peninsula. Located near the Skanör marina, this part of the beach is a favourite spot for bathers in the summer months.

images.copyright: Vineyards in the Moselle Valley, Rhineland-Palatinate, Germany (© Jorg Greuel/Getty Images)
images.title: 'Riesling' to perfection
images.caption: Vineyards above the Moselle River, Rhineland-Palatinate, Germany
images.desc: Welcome to Palatinate, a wine lover's dream come true. Known for its picturesque vineyards, the Palatinate in western Germany is characterised by rolling hills, fertile soils and a warm climate. This favourable terroir allows for the cultivation of a diverse variety of grapes. While Riesling reigns supreme, other notable varieties include Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc, Pinot Blanc, Müller-Thurgau and Dornfelder. Palatinate is the largest red wine-producing region in the country, with over 40% of the vineyards devoted to it.

og.title: Vineyards above the Moselle River, Rhineland-Palatinate, Germany

images.copyright: Defence personnel pay tribute to Kargil martyrs (© Hindustan Times/Contributor/Getty images)
images.title: Valour in stone
images.caption: Kargil Vijay Diwas
images.desc: Every July 26, India comes together in pride and remembrance, honouring the heroes of the Kargil War. The day commemorates our country's major military success against Pakistan during the war. After the 1971 Indo-Pakistani War, direct armed conflicts were rare until the 1990s when tensions rose due to separatist activities in Kashmir and nuclear tests by both nations in 1998. Despite the Lahore Declaration in 1999, Pakistan initiated the covert Operation Badri, leading to the Kargil War that lasted for almost 3 months.

images.copyright: Forest path in Great Smoky Mountains National Park, Tennessee (© putmanphoto/Getty Images)
images.title: Into the thick of it
images.caption: Great Smoky Mountains National Park, Tennessee, USA
images.desc: Fancy a walk through the Smokies in Tennessee, seen in today's image? Spanning over 2,112 square kilometres between North Carolina and Tennessee in the United States, the Great Smoky Mountains National Park is a treasure trove of natural beauty and biodiversity. Home to more than 19,000 documented species, scientists estimate that tens of thousands more remain undiscovered. Kilometres of hiking trails wind through the dense woodlands, leading adventurers to cascading waterfalls and scenic overlooks.

images.copyright: Flock of Swaledale sheep in North Yorkshire, England (© R A Kearton/Getty Images)
images.title: Baa-utiful family
images.caption: Flock of Swaledale sheep in North Yorkshire, England
images.desc: Today's image features a group of Swaledale sheep in the North Yorkshire dales of England. Known for their off-white wool, curled horns and distinctive white markings around their nose and eyes, they are used for lamb and mutton production, breeding the North of England Mule sheep and as pedigree breeding stock. Adapted to the harsh environments they inhabit, Swaledales are exceptionally hardy, with thick coats, strong bodies and a bold disposition. The ewes are excellent mothers, capable of raising lambs successfully even under challenging conditions. With their unique appearance and remarkable adaptability, Swaledale sheep continue to thrive in the dales, contributing significantly to local economies and preserving traditional farming practices.

images.copyright: Methoni Castle, Messinia, Greece (© Andrew Mayovskyy/Shutterstock)
images.title: Echoes of history
images.caption: Methoni Castle, Messinia, Greece
images.desc: Perched on a rocky headland is Methoni Castle, a symbol of medieval might situated on the shores of the Ionian Sea in southern Greece. The fortress is in Methoni, a village in the Messinia region. Built by the Venetians in the early 13th century, this castle was a key trading post and a defensive bastion, protecting the southwestern coastline from invaders. Its Bourtzi tower, an extension of the fortress standing on a small islet, was once connected to the main castle by a stone bridge.

images.copyright: Ellora Caves near Aurangabad, Maharashtra (© saiko3p/Shutterstock)
images.title: 'Heart' of stone
images.caption: Ellora Caves, Maharashtra
images.desc: If you love the serenity of ancient temples, Ellora in Aurangabad district, Maharashtra, is where you need to be. The site is home to over 100 caves carved from the basalt cliffs of the Charanandri Hills, out of which 34 are accessible to the public.

images.copyright: Wooden fishing boats at Kendwa village, Zanzibar, Tanzania (© Lubos Paukeje/Alamy)
images.title: The Spice Island escape
images.caption: Kendwa village, Zanzibar, Tanzania
images.desc: Off the coast of East Africa in the archipelago of Zanzibar—a semi-autonomous region of Tanzania—is the village of Kendwa. Historically, this serene village played a modest role in the island's fishing industry, with traditional wooden boats, known as dhows, etching patterns across the waters.
